objectives.objectiveDescription: Engage in observation, listening, and attending to details in artworks.

expectations.expectationDescription: Notice and point out details and respond to expressive features in artworks.
Distinguish the subject matter and artistic style of two or more visual artists.
Compare the form, materials and techniques in selected works of art using descriptive language.
Identify and compare the purposes for creating art objects from various cultures.
Identify and describe cultural symbols, image and contexts of works of art.
Identify and share the uses of visual art outside the classroom and provide examples.
Generate artmaking ideas from their daily experiences and the environment.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Focus on creation and realization of artworks using diverse artistic skills.

expectations.expectationDescription: Demonstrate increasing skill and craft in the use of art tools and materials with attention to their diverse qualities.
Envision what cannot be observed directly and depict it visually.
Create artworks based on imagination and observation of familiar objects and scenes.
Demonstrate flexibility in their creative processes and use of art materials.
Identify, select and use art and design elements and principles to express emotions and produce a variety of visual effects (e.g., nuances of surface, contour, pattern and tone).
Use visual art materials to express an idea that reflects their own social or cultural identity.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Engage in making connections, reconsidering, questioning, and self-assessing in relation to art.

expectations.expectationDescription: Use basic self-assessment strategies to improve their artworks.
Understand the difference between assessing the quality of an artwork and their personal preference for the work.
Relate the subject matter and ideas in their own artworks to those in the works of others.
Share their personal interpretations of the meanings conveyed in various works of art.
Describe how an artist uses the elements and principles of design to create expressive impact in a work of art.
Identify and articulate important historical and cultural contributions of selected visual artists.
Recognize and discuss that people have various opinions about art and value art for different reasons.

sections.sectionDescription: Notice and point out details and respond to expressive features in artworks.
Distinguish the subject matter and artistic style of two or more visual artists.
Compare the form, materials and techniques in selected works of art using descriptive language.

outline.title: Purpose of Art in Various Cultures

sections.sectionDescription: Identify and compare the purposes for creating art objects from various cultures.
Identify and describe cultural symbols, image and contexts of works of art.

outline.title: Uses of Visual Art Outside the Classroom

sections.sectionDescription: Identify and share the uses of visual art outside the classroom and provide examples.
Generate artmaking ideas from their daily experiences and the environment.

outline.title: Skill and Craft in Art Tools

sections.sectionDescription: Demonstrate increasing skill and craft in the use of art tools and materials with attention to their diverse qualities.
Envision what cannot be observed directly and depict it visually.
Create artworks based on imagination and observation of familiar objects and scenes.
Demonstrate flexibility in their creative processes and use of art materials.
Identify, select and use art and design elements and principles to express emotions and produce a variety of visual effects.

outline.title: Social and Cultural Identity in Art

sections.sectionDescription: Use visual art materials to express an idea that reflects their own social or cultural identity.
Use basic self-assessment strategies to improve their artworks.
Understand the difference between assessing the quality of an artwork and their personal preference for the work.
Relate the subject matter and ideas in their own artworks to those in the works of others.
Share their personal interpretations of the meanings conveyed in various works of art.
Describe how an artist uses the elements and principles of design to create expressive impact in a work of art.
Identify and articulate important historical and cultural contributions of selected visual artists.
Recognize and discuss that people have various opinions about art and value art for different reasons.
Review key concepts and skills related to Perceiving/Knowing learned throughout the year.
Review key concepts and skills related to Producing/Performing learned throughout the year.
Review key concepts and skills related to Responding/Reflecting learned throughout the year.
Explore advanced topics and techniques in visual arts.
Work on creative art projects using advanced techniques.
Engage in art critique sessions to discuss and evaluate artworks.
Begin planning final interdisciplinary projects that incorporate various techniques and concepts learned during the year.
Develop and refine final interdisciplinary projects.
Continue refining final interdisciplinary projects.
Finalize interdisciplinary projects, preparing for presentation.
Present final interdisciplinary projects to the class, explaining the integration of various concepts.
Review and reflect on key visual arts concepts learned throughout the year.
Integrate key concepts from various aspects of visual arts.
Develop advanced projects applying various techniques and concepts learned during the year.
Present advanced projects to the class, explaining the integration of various advanced concepts.
Celebrate the accomplishments and projects completed during the year.
